item.title: X.3: Device Drivers
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld and Jo Vliegen)
item.description: General The kernel of an operating system has a lot of different tasks. Some of them we visited in earlier chapters. One task of the OS is the management of the different hardware devices that are typically connected to a processor in a laptop, desktop, or server. The OS has to know how to talk to a certain device. Typically an Application Programming Interface (an API) is provided to the user space, so users can interact with the hardware.
